Articles.Content:
10 hours ago, Ratfox said:

all lamps are not blinking, only emitted light blinks

I noticed it earlier, and it seems to be a Stock bug.  The lenses of the lights are not blinking, regardless of whether emission is turned on.  I think the light emission toggle is just to save lighting graphics resources for when you just want an indicator.

I thought there was a width and intensity control, but that may have come with Surface Mounted Lights.  EDIT: Yes, it did.

Edited February 2, 2021 by KSPrynk

have any ideas in which config it can be fixed? in update 1.11.0 it worked in both the stock and restocks

re: everything looks fine in configs. seems to be an animation problem. why squads got into animation, that's the question

Edited February 2, 2021 by Ratfox

It could be something to do with the fact this change was made for 1.11.1:  

* For parts using ModuleLight, the light turning on/off is controlled by code now, instead of using an animation.

Will take a look in due course.

Edited February 2, 2021 by Poodmund

1 hour ago, Poodmund said:

It could be something to do with the fact this change was made for 1.11.1:  


* For parts using ModuleLight, the light turning on/off is controlled by code now, instead of using an animation.

 

Now it is clear. Thank for the clarification

Will there ever be a silver variant for the Mk1-3 command pod, like on the real real Apollo command modules?
I know that the stock Textures Unlimited config will do this, but will it work with this mod?

Hey, I have found that the Plane-anywhere 1 linear rcs thing is literally impossible to click on.

I put it on one of my creations, but I haven't been able to take it off, configure it, offset it, nor set it to an action group. It's literally stuck there.

Can I expect a solution for this?

Edited February 3, 2021 by kerbalxploder

1 hour ago, kerbalxploder said:

Hey, I have found that the Plane-anywhere 1 linear rcs thing is literally impossible to click on.

I put it on one of my creations, but I haven't been able to take it off, configure it, offset it, nor set it to an action group. It's literally stuck there.

Can I expect a solution for this?

this problem is solved if your KSP version is 1.11.1 and Restock version is 1.3.1. tested, all RCS work

On 12/29/2019 at 9:53 PM, Nittany Tiger said:

Not sure if this is Restock+ or Probes Before Crew causing this, but I am getting part test contracts for parts that are marked "soft-depreciated."  I was getting frustrated when I would accept a contract to test a RT-1 Mallet only for the contract to fail itself in the VAB.  Here is my mod list:

  Reveal hidden contents

  • Astrogator
  • Better SRBs

  • TriggerAu Flags

 

While searching Google for this issue, I found someone way back on page 44 with the exact issue over a year ago, but sadly no one answered.

I am having the same problem with the RT-1 Mallet and RT-2 Striker showing in the Part Test contracts, leading to failure when I go into the VAB.

These parts were deprecated back in Restock+ 1.0.0, so not sure how to make the contract use only parts I have available.

10 hours ago, vdubjones said:

While searching Google for this issue, I found someone way back on page 44 with the exact issue over a year ago, but sadly no one answered.

I am having the same problem with the RT-1 Mallet and RT-2 Striker showing in the Part Test contracts, leading to failure when I go into the VAB.

These parts were deprecated back in Restock+ 1.0.0, so not sure how to make the contract use only parts I have available.

Oh, so it's deprecation that causes that bug. I had noticed the bug in my game but hadn't yet bothered to track down the cause.

Try a MM patch with this: 

@PART[*]:HAS[#TechHidden[True]]:FINAL
{
	!MODULE[ModuleTestSubject] {}
}

10 hours ago, Ratfox said:

this problem is solved if your KSP version is 1.11.1 and Restock version is 1.3.1. tested, all RCS work

Of course. I keep missing updates
found that the lamps still blink on the outdoors
would a craft file be affected if I uninstall  restock while a part has a restock-only part skin?

On 2/5/2021 at 5:13 PM, MacerSpaceflight said:

would a craft file be affected if I uninstall  restock while a part has a restock-only part skin?

I don't think so...

Hey can you add animated brakes that after some time of braking get red hot????

Edited February 10, 2021 by BlackEyedPhantom
I don't think that's possible with the way stock wheels work

13 minutes ago, The Dressian Exploder said:

I don't think that's possible with the way stock wheels work

I think you could apply two conditions. If the wheel is going over 50 m/s, and brake is held for more than 2 seconds, then start the animation for the disc to glow red.

37 minutes ago, GuessingEveryDay said:

I think you could apply two conditions. If the wheel is going over 50 m/s, and brake is held for more than 2 seconds, then start the animation for the disc to glow red.

Or it could just be an emissive animation triggered by the brake action (2 seconds of nothing then glow). Actually the stock retractable landing gears already do that to some extent with their little brake indicators on the back.
I can't select the small linear RCS in the editor, playing on 1.11.1 with the newest version

1 hour ago, Starhelperdude said:

I can't select the small linear RCS in the editor, playing on 1.11.1 with the newest version

That’s very odd - this issue showed up in 1.11.0 + Restock 1.3.0, and was ostensibly fixed in Restock 1.3.1. At any rate, a little more info would certainly be helpful to those who can help - other mods, clean installation testing, logs, you know the drill. 

Edited February 15, 2021 by RyanRising

23 hours ago, GuessingEveryDay said:

I think you could apply two conditions. If the wheel is going over 50 m/s, and brake is held for more than 2 seconds, then start the animation for the disc to glow red.

Yea! That wold be great!

No, there will not be.

It will revert to the default version.
